oDataFilterHelpers¶

Methods to help with the syntax of oData filter params.

oDataFilterHelper¶

class axiomapy.odatahelpers.oDataFilterHelper[source]¶

A set of static methods to help with the oData syntax. This is not meant to replicate all of oData capabilities. For full information see: http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.0/errata03/os/complete/part2-url-conventions/odata-v4.0-errata03-os-part2-url-conventions-complete.html#_Toc453752358 :returns: [description] :rtype: [type]

and_str = ' and '¶
or_str = ' or '¶
not_str = ' not '¶

static in_(field_name: str, *values: str, camelize: bool = True) → str[source]¶
static equals(field_name: str, value: Union[str, int, float], camelize: bool = True) → str[source]¶
The eq operator returns true if the left operand is equal to the right

operand, otherwise it returns false.

The null value is equal to itself, and only to itself.

Parameters

  • field_name (str) – The name of the field to compare. Pass None for null.

  • value (Union[str, int, float]) – The value to compare.

  • camelize (bool) – Camelize the field_name. Defaults to True.

Returns

field_name eq value or field_name eq ‘value’

e.g Name eq ‘My Portfolio’

Return type

str

static not_equals(field_name: str, value: Union[str, int, float], camelize: bool = True) → str[source]¶
The ne operator returns true if the left operand is not equal to the right

operand, otherwise it returns false.

The null value is equal to itself, and only to itself.

Parameters

  • field_name (str) – The name of the field to compare. Pass None for null.

  • value (Union[str, int, float]) – The value to compare.

  • camelize (bool) – Camelize the field_name. Defaults to True.

Returns

field_name neq value or field_name neq ‘value’

e.g Name neq ‘My Portfolio’

Return type

str

static greater_than(field_name: str, value: Union[str, int, float], camelize: bool = True) → str[source]¶
The gt operator returns true if the left operand is greater than the right

operand, otherwise it returns false.

If any operand is null, the operator returns false. For Boolean values, true is greater than false.

Parameters

  • field_name (str) – The name of the field to compare.

  • value (Union[str, int, float]) – The value to compare. Pass None for null.

  • camelize (bool) – Camelize the field_name. Defaults to True.

Returns

field_name gt value or field_name gt ‘value’

e.g Name gt ‘My Portfolio’

Return type

str

static greater_than_or_equal(field_name: str, value: Union[str, int, float], camelize: bool = True) → str[source]¶
The ge operator returns true if the left operand is greater than or equal to

the right operand, otherwise it returns false.

If only one operand is null, the operator returns false. If both operands are

null, it returns true because null is equal to itself.

Parameters

  • field_name (str) – The name of the field to compare.

  • value (Union[str, int, float]) – The value to compare. Pass None for null.

  • camelize (bool) – Camelize the field_name. Defaults to True.

Returns

field_name ge value or field_name ge ‘value’

e.g Name ge ‘My Portfolio’

Return type

str

static less_than_or_equal(field_name: str, value: Union[str, int, float], camelize: bool = True) → str[source]¶
The le operator returns true if the left operand is less than or equal to the

right operand, otherwise it returns false.

If only one operand is null, the operator returns false. If both operands are

null, it returns true because null is equal to itself.

Parameters

  • field_name (str) – The name of the field to compare.

  • value (Union[str, int, float]) – The value to compare. Pass None for null.

  • camelize (bool) – Camelize the field_name. Defaults to True.

Returns

field_name le value or field_name le ‘value’

e.g Name le ‘My Portfolio’

Return type

str

static less_than(field_name: str, value: Union[str, int, float], camelize: bool = True) → str[source]¶

The lt operator returns true if the left operand is less than the right operand, otherwise it returns false.

If any operand is null, the operator returns false.

Parameters

  • field_name (str) – The name of the field to compare.

  • value (Union[str, int, float]) – The value to compare. Pass None for null.

  • camelize (bool) – Camelize the field_name. Defaults to True.

Returns

field_name lt value or field_name lt ‘value’

e.g Name lt ‘My Portfolio’

Return type

str

static starts_with(field_name: str, value: str, camelize: bool = True) → str[source]¶
The startswith function returns true if the first parameter string value

starts with the second parameter string value, otherwise it returns false.

Parameters

  • field_name (str) – The name of the field to compare.

  • value (str) – The value to compare.

  • camelize (bool) – Camelize the field_name. Defaults to True.

Returns

startswith(field_name,’value’) e.g. startswith(Name, ‘My Port’)

Return type

[str]

static ends_with(field_name: str, value: str, camelize: bool = True) → str[source]¶
The endswith function returns true if the first parameter string value ends

with the second parameter string value, otherwise it returns false.

Parameters

  • field_name (str) – The name of the field to compare.

  • value (str) – The value to compare.

  • camelize (bool) – Camelize the field_name. Defaults to True.

Returns

endswith(field_name,’value’) e.g. endswith(Name, ‘folio’)

Return type

[str]

static contains(field_name: str, value: str, camelize: bool = True) → str[source]¶
The contains function returns true if the second parameter string value is a

substring of the first parameter string value, otherwise it returns false.

Parameters

  • field_name (str) – The name of the field to compare.

  • value (str) – The value to compare.

  • camelize (bool) – Camelize the field_name. Defaults to True.

Returns

contains(field_name,’value’) e.g. contains(Name, ‘folio’)

Return type

[str]

static to_lower(field_name: str, camelize: bool = True) → str[source]¶

The tolower function returns the input parameter string value with all uppercase characters converted to lowercase according to Unicode rules.

Parameters

  • field_name (str) – The field name.

  • camelize (bool) – Camelize the field_name. Defaults to True.

Returns

tolower(field_name) e.g. lower(Name)

Return type

[str]

static to_upper(field_name: str, camelize: bool = True) → str[source]¶
The toupper function returns the input parameter string value with all

lowercase characters converted to uppercase according to Unicode rules.

Parameters

  • field_name (str) – The field name.

  • camelize (bool) – Camelize the field_name. Defaults to True.

Returns

toupper(field_name) e.g. toupper(Name)

Return type

[str]

static length(field_name: str, camelize: bool = True) → str[source]¶

The length function returns the number of characters in the parameter value.

Parameters

  • field_name (str) – The field name.

  • camelize (bool) – Camelize the field_name. Defaults to True.

Returns

length(field_name) e.g. length(Name)
